title: Notes for developers
text: R Packages (2e) Hadley Wickham Jennifer Bryan Advanced R Hadley Wickham Creating R packages Kurt Hornik R Core Team

title: Notes for developers
text: Unit tests implemented teststhat tests/testthat (run just test-unit). keep unit tests fast still test full pipeline (download tidy) integration tests tests/integration.R (run just test-integration). may way also add integration tests testthat without running every time (possible using environment variables), haven’t explored yet. just recipe just test runs tests.

title: Notes for developers
text: Documentation built pkgdown.

title: Notes for developers
text: Install package locally: just build (pak::local_install()) Make changes code Run just fix format Run just document changed roxygen2 docs Run just test verify tests pass schema updates: just update-schemas Run just check submitting PR Update docs just docs needed

title: Notes for developers
text: Data sources transformations defined inst/config/ YAML files: Raw data sources (archives, URLs, periods): - raw_annual_data_config.yml: Annual datasets - raw_monthly_data_config.yml: Monthly datasets - raw_metadata_config.yml: Metadata Tidy transformations (filters, derivations, output columns): - tidy_annual_data_config.yml - tidy_monthly_data_config.yml - tidy_metadata_config.yml Schemas (auto-generated column tracking): - Run just update-schemas modifying raw_annual_data_config.yml - Schemas saved inst/schemas/annual_main_schemas.csv

title: Notes for developers
text: Internal functions R/dev-utils.R help explore archive contents exposing new data package: - list_available_archives(): See archives periods - list_archive_files("annual_main", "2024-25"): List CSV files archive - read_archive_file("annual_main", "2024-25", "main"): Read specific files - compare_schemas("main"): Compare column changes across periods Access via devtools::load_all() nhstt:::function_name().

title: How to use the monthly activity and performance data
text: start loading R packages downloading monthly activity performance dataset get_activity_performance_monthly(). report contains monthly performance indicators NHS Talking Therapies services across England. activity_performance dataset defined contains total 204 different activity performance measures, available January 2024 May 2024 (5 reporting periods).
code: # Load nhstt package for data library(nhstt)  # Load other packages for analysis library(ggplot2) library(lubridate) library(dplyr) library(scales) library(stringr) library(gt)  # Get 5 monthly activity performance reports activity_performance <- get_activity_performance_monthly(   periods = c("2024-01", "2024-02", "2024-03", "2024-04", "2024-05") )

previous_headings: Setup > Example 1: Explore changes in referrals that ended
what: Define measures related to referrals that ended
title: How to use the monthly activity and performance data
text: Using get_metadata_monthly() function, can look descriptions measures:
code: # Define measure ids for analysis referral_ended_measures <- c(   "M057",   "M058",   "M059",   "M060",   "M061",   "M066",   "M340",   "M062",   "M063",   "M066",   "M344",   "M341",   "M069",   "M342",   "M070",   "M071" ) #> ℹ Downloading metadata_measures_monthly (monthly) for 2025-07 #> ! Download failed (attempt 1/3), retrying... #> ℹ Downloading metadata_measures_monthly (monthly) for 2025-07! Download failed (attempt 2/3), retrying... #> ℹ Downloading metadata_measures_monthly (monthly) for 2025-07✖ Downloading metadata_measures_monthly (monthly) for 2025-07 ... failed #>  #> ! Download failed, using package metadata for 2025-07

previous_headings: Setup > Example 1: Explore changes in referrals that ended
title: How to use the monthly activity and performance data
text: filter data include measures defined referral_ended_measures select service providers: Now can visualise trends time broken codes referrals ended service provider. Note y-axis scales fixed allow better visualisation trends measures different count ranges. Trends counts different referrals ended measures.
code: # Select data for analysis selected_activity_performance <- activity_performance |>   filter(measure_id %in% c(referral_ended_measures)) |>   filter(group_type == "Provider")

previous_headings: Setup > Example 2: Explore wait times from referrral to first treatment
title: How to use the monthly activity and performance data
text: explore changes following measures related wait times referrral first treatment. Note measures related wait times available dataset.
code: # Define measure ids for analysis first_tx_waited_measures <- c(   "M039",   "M040",   "M041",   "M042",   "M043",   "M044",   "M045" )

previous_headings: Setup > Example 2: Explore wait times from referrral to first treatment
title: How to use the monthly activity and performance data
text: filter data include measures defined first_tx_waited_measures select service providers: Now can visualise trends time broken different waiting time periods referral first treatment, one line service provider. Trends counts different waiting time periods referral first treatment service.
code: # Select data for analysis selected_activity_performance <- activity_performance |>   filter(measure_id %in% first_tx_waited_measures) |>   filter(group_type == "Provider")

what: Example 3: Compare a measure across different providers
title: How to use the monthly activity and performance data
text: can also focus single measure compare counts across different services. example look measure M344 (Count referrals ended reporting period end code ‘Termination treatment earlier Care Professional planned’) visualise trends time four providers highest overall counts. identify 4 providers recorded activity M344 across whole time period: can use list (top4_m344_providers) filter data plot trends four providers: Counts referrals measure M344 four providers highest totals.
code: top4_m344_providers <- activity_performance |>   filter(measure_id == "M344") |>   filter(group_type == "Provider") |>   select(org_name2, value) |>   group_by(org_name2) |>   summarise(total = sum(value, na.rm = TRUE)) |>   slice_max(total, n = 4) |>   pull(org_name2)

title: How to use the annual key measures data
text: start loading necessary packages downloading annual key measures dataset get_key_measures_annual(). report contains annual performance indicators NHS Talking Therapies services across England.
code: # Load packages library(nhstt) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) library(scales) library(stringr)  # Get key_measures data # When running this for the first time it will download and tidy the reports key_measures <- get_key_measures_annual(   periods = c("2022-23", "2023-24", "2024-25") )

title: How to use the annual key measures data
text: filter data focus received referrals finished treatments regional level. step requires careful exploration underlying data structure.
code: # Select data for analysis selected_measures <- key_measures |>   filter(org_type == "Commissioning Region") |>   filter(!org_name == "UNKNOWN") |>   filter(     measure_name %in% c("referrals_received", "finished_course_treatment")   ) |>   filter(measure_statistic == "count") |>   filter(variable_a == "Depression") |>   select(     start_date,     end_date,     org_name,     variable_a,     measure_statistic,     measure_name,     value   )  # Tidy data for analysis selected_measures <- selected_measures |>   mutate(     org_name = str_to_title(str_remove(org_name, "\\s*COMMISSIONING REGION$")),     org_name = str_replace_all(org_name, "\\b(Of|And)\\b", tolower),     measure_name = factor(       measure_name,       levels = c("referrals_received", "finished_course_treatment"),       labels = c("Referrals received", "Finished course of treatment")     )   )

title: How to use the annual key measures data
text: Finally, visualise trends time region. Trends counts referrals received finished course treatment depression broken region.

title: How to use the annual PROMs data
text: start loading necessary packages downloading annual PROMS dataset get_proms_annual(). report contains clinical outcome measures including PHQ-9, GAD-7, WSAS scores NHS Talking Therapies services across England.
code: # Load packages library(nhstt) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) library(tidyr) library(stringr)  # Get PROMS data # When running this for the first time it will download and tidy the reports proms <- get_proms_annual()

title: How to use the annual PROMs data
text: filter data focus effect sizes GAD-7 PHQ-9 measures national England level depression, selecting six specific therapy types: applied relaxation, CBT, collaborative care, brief psychodynamic psychotherapy, computer-based guided non-guided self-help. step requires careful exploration underlying data structure.
code: selected_proms <- proms |>   filter(org_type == "England") |>   filter(!org_name == "UNKNOWN") |>   filter(variable_a == "Depression") |>   filter(     variable_b %in%       c(         "Applied relaxation",         "Cognitive Behaviour Therapy (CBT)",         "Collaborative Care",         "Brief psychodynamic psychotherapy",         "Guided Self Help (Computer)",         "Non-Guided Self Help (Computer)"       )   ) |>   filter(measure_name %in% c("phq", "gad")) |>   filter(measure_statistic %in% c("effect_size")) |>   mutate(     measure_name = factor(       measure_name,       levels = c("gad", "phq"),       labels = c("GAD-7", "PHQ-9")     ),     measure_statistic = factor(       measure_statistic,       levels = c("effect_size"),       labels = c("Effect size")     )   )

title: How to use the annual PROMs data
text: Finally, visualise effect sizes GAD-7 PHQ-9 across selected therapy types depression treatment England, showing trends two reporting periods. GAD-7 PHQ-9 effect sizes therapy type depression treatment England.

title: Clear cache — cache_clear
text: Removes cached data files. default clears cache. clearing "" cache, also removes initialization marker, trigger welcome message next package load.

title: Clear cache — cache_clear
Clear cache — cache_clear
text: type Character, specifying cache type clear ("", "raw", "tidy"). Default "".

title: Clear cache — cache_clear
text: Invisible TRUE

title: Clear cache — cache_clear
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Clear all cache cache_clear()  # Clear only raw data cache cache_clear(type = "raw")  # Clear only tidy data cache cache_clear(type = "tidy") } # }

what: Calculate percentiles for a numeric variable — summarise_percentiles

text: Summarises numeric variable calculating specified percentiles, optionally grouped period grouping variables. Useful creating percentile distributions time across different measures.

title: Calculate percentiles for a numeric variable — summarise_percentiles
code: summarise_percentiles(   df,   period_col,   value_col,   percentiles = seq(0.1, 0.9, 0.1),   group_by = NULL )

title: Calculate percentiles for a numeric variable — summarise_percentiles
text: df Data frame tibble containing data summarise period_col Column name period variable, used ordering results. Typically date column e.g., end_date value_col Column name numeric variable calculate percentiles percentiles Numeric vector percentiles calculate, specified proportions 0 1. Default seq(0.1, 0.9, 0.1) (10th 90th percentiles 10s) group_by Optional grouping variables. Can single column name vector column names using c(). Default NULL.

title: Calculate percentiles for a numeric variable — summarise_percentiles
text: tibble columns period, percentile values, calculated values, grouping variables.

title: Calculate percentiles for a numeric variable — summarise_percentiles
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Calculate percentiles by period data |>   summarise_percentiles(     period_col = end_date,     value_col = recovery_rate   )  # Calculate quartiles grouped by measure data |>   summarise_percentiles(     period_col = end_date,     value_col = value,     percentiles = c(0.25, 0.5, 0.75),     group_by = measure_id   )  # Multiple grouping variables data |>   summarise_percentiles(     period_col = end_date,     value_col = value,     group_by = c(measure_id, region_name)   ) } # }

title: Record version metadata — write_tidy_versions_json
text: dataset Character, specifying dataset name (e.g., "key_measures_annual", "activity_performance_monthly") period Character, specifying reporting period (e.g., "2023-24" annual, "2025-09" monthly) frequency Character, specifying report frequency ("annual" "monthly") raw_data_hash Character, specifying SHA256 hash raw_data_url Character, specifying source URL
